intro: Leucas eriostoma var. stocksii, commonly known as the hairy leucas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture. Its small, clustered flowers typically bloom in shades of purple or blue, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
